value.title: Looking at Power BI Many to Many
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick takes a look at Power BI Many to Many relationships. This was part of the July 2018 Power BI Desktop release and can enable some awesome capabilities. Patrick looks at why you may not want to use Power BI Many to Many even though you think you do.  Many to Many documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/desktop-many-to-many-relationships

value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.title: Create paginated reports
value.excerpt: Paginated reports allow report developers to create Power BI artifacts that have tightly controlled rendering requirements. Paginated reports are ideal for creating sales invoices, receipts, purchase orders, and tabular data. This module will teach you how to create reports, add parameters, and work with tables and charts in paginated reports.

value.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to clean, transform, and load data in Power BI.

value.title: Optimize a model for performance in Power BI
value.excerpt: Performance optimization, also known as performance tuning, involves making changes to the current state of the data model so that it runs more efficiently. Essentially, when your data model is optimized, it performs better.

value.title: Use visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create and customize visuals to present data in compelling and insightful ways.

value.title: #41 Understanding relationships in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: You normally build relationships in Power BI (connect two tables together) so you can work with the data in both tables as if they were a single table.  In this video you will learn how to create relationships, understand what and how to use the advance options and troubleshoot the most common problems.

value.title: Deployment Pipelines give you more CONTROL (Power BI Premium)
value.excerpt: With Deployment Pipelines, you can control your application life cycle stages. Keep content in sync at the different stages of your development. Power BI Premium is required.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/deployment-pipelines-overview https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/deployment-pipelines-process

value.title: Embed a dashboard from Power BI into your application
value.excerpt: In this video, I go over the embed a dashboard sample and walk you through how to actually embed a dashboard into your application. This uses a combination of the Power BI REST APIs and the JavaScript API.  Embed Dashboards in Your Applications to Monitor Your Business in Context (Blog) - https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/embed-dashboard/

value.title: Power BI Tutorial | From Flat File To Data Model
value.excerpt: In this Power BI Tutorial, Patrick looks at how to load data from a flat file to the data model. This could be a text, csv or excel file with a lot of columns.
